about.intro: Founded in 2005, Fluorez Technology Inc. has been dedicated to providing the highest quality perfluoroelastomer (FFKM) products for the global market since its inception. In response to rapid market changes and the pursuit of economic efficiency, and in line with Taiwan's Ministry of Economic Affairs Industrial Development Bureau's policy of localizing semiconductor consumables production, we have further developed our own Taiwan-manufactured perfluoroelastomer brand, Fluorez®.

professional.title: Professional
professional.content: Fluorez Technology Inc.'s expertise comes from years of market experience and reputation. We believe that good communication is the key to choosing the right materials. Fluorez Technology not only offers a diverse product line including perfluoroelastomer compounds, but also provides standard components manufactured from fluoro-elastomer (FKM) and perfluoro-elastomers (FFKM). We also accept customized FKM/FFKM products tailored to consumer needs. We continuously develop new formulations for applications and have developed products that comply with FDA and USP Class VI standards to meet the needs of the food and medical industries.

quality.title: Quality
quality.content: Fluorez Technology Inc. complies with ISO quality certification, and all products are tested by third-party laboratories, meeting a series of standards including the latest EU chemical control and hazardous chemicals regulations. Clean room production specifications also follow international ASTM and ISO standards. The highest standard of product sampling testing has become the backbone supporting our delivery of high-standard products.

service.title: Service
service.content: Over the years, we have collaborated with different customers on various OEM and ODM production models, going beyond production and sales to provide comprehensive solutions to customers. We also provide pre-sales and after-sales laboratory analysis, supporting customer problem-solving solutions. Customized inventory management solutions better meet customer efficiency and cost requirements.

pfas.a1: At Fluorez Technology Inc., we take product safety and compliance with international environmental regulations very seriously. We fully understand the concerns surrounding PFAS (Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances), chemicals known for their persistence and potential health risks.
pfas.a2: PFAS are a large group of synthetic chemicals widely used in many industries for their unique properties such as water resistance, oil resistance, low friction, and stability. However, certain PFAS, such as PFOA (Perfluorooctanoic Acid) and PFOS (Perfluorooctanesulfonic Acid), are of particular concern due to their long-term persistence and potential to accumulate in the environment and living organisms.
pfas.a3: We strictly comply with global regulatory standards to ensure our products do not contain regulated PFAS compounds such as PFOA and PFOS. These regulations include EU REACH, US EPA, and other international agency standards. Our raw materials, including FKM and FFKM, are thoroughly reviewed to ensure they do not contain prohibited PFAS compounds. We regularly audit our supply chain and update materials according to changing regulatory standards.
pfas.a4:
Our commitment to safety and environmental responsibility ensures that all our products meet the highest standards. Whether it's seals for the automotive industry or components for semiconductor manufacturing, we ensure products comply with regulations in Europe, North America, Asia, and other regions.
Through ongoing collaboration with trusted suppliers like Solvay, ACG, and Chemours, we stay at the forefront of regulatory changes, ensuring our products remain compliant and safe across various applications.
We are your trusted partner for environmentally responsible sealing solutions.

row1.substances: PFOS and its salts and related compounds, PFOA and its salts and related compounds

index.intro:
Fluorez Technology Inc. offers a diverse range of fluorine products and fluoroelastomer products. We are committed to Taiwan manufacturing and have created a series of Femrex™ fluoroelastomer (FKM) finished products, as well as Varion™ series perfluoroelastomer (FFKM) compounds and finished products. Fluorez's in-house laboratory provides rigorous test data to ensure the quality and stability of each product. We offer fluoroelastomer O-rings, compression parts, sealing strips, gaskets, molded sheets, expansion seals, and metal-bonded fluoroelastomer parts. We also accept custom orders for O-ring repair kits and Teflon FEP/PFA encapsulated O-rings.
We not only provide finished FKM/FFKM products but also offer FFKM compound semi-finished products.
index.feature1_subtitle: Fluoroelastomer (FKM) has different brand names from different manufacturers. DuPont®'s FKM brand name is Viton®, 3M®'s FKM brand name is Dyneon®; Daikin®'s brand name is DAI-EL®, and Japanese Asahi Glass®'s brand name is Aflas®.
index.feature2_subtitle: Fluoroelastomer (FKM) has different brand names from different manufacturers. DuPont®'s FKM brand name is Viton®, 3M®'s FKM brand name is Dyneon®; Daikin®'s brand name is DAI-EL®, and Japanese Asahi Glass®'s brand name is Aflas®.
index.feature3_subtitle:
• Non-flammable even in high oxygen oxidizing environments
• Does not react with metals, plastics, rubber, or most materials
• Wide working temperature range from -60°C to 165°C
• Excellent insulation properties at both high and low temperatures
• Superior thermal conductivity
index.feature4_subtitle: PTFE micropowder is a low molecular weight polytetrafluoroethylene powder with an average particle size of 3-20μm, produced from high molecular weight PTFE resin. PTFE micropowder has excellent wear resistance, non-stick properties, electrical insulation, and extremely low friction coefficient, making it ideal for lubrication and as a coating for non-stick pans and pipe linings.

feature5.title:
Sustainable Commitment to
Safety and Environmental Responsibility
feature5.content: Safe and reliable products compliant with global regulatory standards

feature6.title: ISO 9001, JIS mark and IATF 16949 Quality Policy
feature6.content_1: We fully implement ISO 9001, JIS Q1001, and IATF 16949 related operation standards to structure our quality management system, enhance stainless steel expertise and service quality, and implement continuous improvement to enhance quality and productivity to achieve customer satisfaction. We commit to establishing quality objectives based on our quality policy and implementing various improvement measures to continuously improve our quality management system while meeting customer and regulatory requirements.

service.pageIntro: At Fluorez Technology, we are dedicated to providing high-performance elastomer solutions through advanced manufacturing processes and customer-centric services. We focus on providing customized compounds, customized finished parts, and inventory planning to meet specific customer needs.
service.customCompoundText1: We understand that each application scenario is unique, and therefore material requirements vary. Fluorez provides tailored FFKM and FKM elastomer compound services, ensuring materials have ideal chemical resistance, thermal stability, and mechanical durability.
service.customCompoundText2: Our laboratory team works closely with customers to develop specialized compounds optimized for harsh environments, such as high-temperature operations or contact with strong acids and bases.
service.customPartsText: Beyond providing raw materials, Fluorez offers custom finished parts according to customer specifications. From simple O-rings, metal composite parts, various special-shaped parts, or extra-large O-rings, to customized complex sealing solutions, our manufacturing processes deliver precision rubber parts that meet strict industry standards. We leverage extensive customer requirements and provide parts made from FFKM and FKM compounds suitable for aerospace, semiconductor, chemical processing, and other industries.
service.inventoryPlanText: Fluorez Technology provides inventory planning services to help customers manage their supply chain more effectively. By maintaining stock levels of critical compounds and finished parts, we ensure you receive the materials you need on time, reducing downtime and improving operational efficiency. Our inventory solutions align with your production schedules, ensuring availability when you need it.
service.technicalSupportText: We not only provide materials but also offer complete technical support to help you select products suitable for your needs. With our own advanced laboratory, we can assist customers with failure analysis, quickly diagnose and solve material performance issues.

ffkm.title: FFKM Perfluoroelastomer

chemicalResistant.title: Chemical Resistant Perfluoroelastomer
chemicalResistant.description: Based on top-grade chemical-resistant perfluoroelastomer, this product offers the broadest chemical resistance among elastomer products, suitable for the most demanding acid, alkali, and solvent applications. Due to its formulation emphasizing chemical resistance, its temperature resistance is relatively lower. However, its chemical resistance far surpasses other rubber products.
chemicalResistant.equivalent: Chemical resistant FKM. Equivalent to Kalrez® 6375, Chemraz® 505.

thermalResistant.title: Thermal Resistant Perfluoroelastomer
thermalResistant.description1: Based on nitrile-crosslinked perfluoroelastomer formulation, besides excellent and broad chemical resistance, temperature resistance is increased to 330°C, suitable for processes requiring high temperature, whether in petrochemical industry, semiconductor equipment, and various applications requiring sealing of organic solutions.
thermalResistant.description2: For different applications, we offer different formulations and provide customized formulation services. All materials are available in both finished and semi-finished products.
thermalResistant.equivalent: Thermal resistant FFKM. Equivalent to Kalrez® 4079

highPurity.title: High Purity Perfluoroelastomer
highPurity.intro: High Purity Perfluoroelastomer (HPFFKM) has the following characteristics:
highPurity.feature1: Excellent chemical stability: Perfluoroelastomer has extremely strong chemical resistance, able to resist corrosion from almost all chemicals, including strong acids, bases, solvents, etc.
highPurity.feature2: Extremely low extractables: High purity perfluoroelastomer has very low extractables during use, which is crucial for applications requiring high cleanliness (such as semiconductor manufacturing, medical equipment, pharmaceutical industry).
highPurity.feature3: Excellent high temperature performance: This type of rubber can operate stably at extremely high temperatures (typically up to 300°C or higher) for long periods without significant performance degradation.
highPurity.feature4: Low gas permeability: High purity perfluoroelastomer has very low gas permeability, making it ideal for vacuum environments and applications requiring gas-tightness.
highPurity.feature5: Outstanding mechanical properties: Perfluoroelastomer has high strength, elasticity, and wear resistance, maintaining excellent performance in harsh physical environments.
highPurity.feature6: Wide temperature range adaptability: Besides high temperature resistance, this type of rubber maintains good elasticity and sealing performance at low temperatures, adapting to a wide range of working temperatures.
highPurity.feature7: Plasma erosion resistance: High purity perfluoroelastomer remains stable in plasma environments and resists plasma erosion, which is particularly important for plasma etching processes in semiconductor manufacturing.
highPurity.feature8: High purity processing: During production, this type of rubber typically undergoes special clean treatment to ensure product cleanliness meets high-requirement applications.
highPurity.applications: High purity perfluoroelastomer is widely used in semiconductor manufacturing, chemical processing, pharmaceuticals, medical equipment, and other fields requiring high cleanliness and chemical corrosion resistance due to its excellent chemical and physical properties.
highPurity.customization: For different semiconductor process needs, we have also developed different high purity perfluoroelastomer formulations. All materials are available in both finished and semi-finished products.

lowCompression.title: Low Compression Set Perfluoroelastomer
lowCompression.description: Low Compression Set Perfluoroelastomer has several advantages, including: 1. Excellent durability: Low compression set rubber maintains its elasticity and shape during long-term use, reducing material fatigue and deformation, extending service life. 2. Good sealing performance: Due to its lower compression set rate, this rubber material maintains good sealing effect in sealing applications, preventing liquid or gas leakage. 3. Wide temperature range: Low compression set rubber typically maintains its performance across a wide temperature range, making it suitable for various extreme temperature environments. 4. Chemical resistance: Low compression set perfluoroelastomer materials typically have excellent chemical resistance, able to resist corrosion from various chemicals, suitable for chemical and petroleum industries. 5. High elasticity: Low compression set rubber has excellent elasticity and resilience, able to quickly recover its original shape under repeated compression. 6. Wide application range: Low compression set rubber is widely used in automotive, electronics, aerospace, medical, and other industries, demonstrating its versatility.
lowCompression.applications: These advantages make low compression set rubber irreplaceable in applications requiring high-performance sealing and durability. All materials are available in both finished and semi-finished products.
lowCompression.equivalent: Low compression set, Thermal resistant FFKM. Equivalent to Kalrez® 7075

foodMedical.title: Food and Medical Grade
foodMedical.intro: Food and Medical Grade Perfluoroelastomer (FFKM) has the following characteristics: Compliance with food and medical standards: This type of perfluoroelastomer material complies with strict standards in food and medical industries, such as FDA (Food and Drug Administration) and USP Class VI (United States Pharmacopeia Class VI), ensuring its safety and reliability when in contact with food and medical products.
foodMedical.feature1: Extremely low extractables: Food and medical grade perfluoroelastomer has very low extractables during use, which is crucial for avoiding contamination of food and medical products.
foodMedical.feature2: Chemical resistance: This rubber material has excellent chemical resistance, able to resist corrosion from various chemicals, including acids, bases, solvents, and cleaning agents, suitable for applications requiring frequent cleaning and sterilization.
foodMedical.feature3: High temperature performance: Food and medical grade perfluoroelastomer maintains its physical and chemical properties at high temperatures, without degradation or failure, suitable for high-temperature sterilization processes.
foodMedical.feature4: Biocompatibility: This rubber material is non-toxic and non-irritating to human tissue, with good biocompatibility, suitable for sealing and contact parts in medical equipment and devices.
foodMedical.feature5: Excellent mechanical properties: Possesses high strength, elasticity, and wear resistance, maintaining stable sealing performance and mechanical strength during long-term use.
foodMedical.feature6: Low gas permeability: Has low gas permeability, ensuring effective gas-tightness and protection in food and medical applications.
foodMedical.fdaDescription1: FDA (Food and Drug Administration) has established regulations for rubber use in food-related applications, FDA CFR 21.177.2600 is a U.S. regulation and international standard. FDA CFR 21.177.2600 Sections A to D describe regulations for reusable rubber products. FDA CFR 21.177.2600 Sections E and F specify extractable limits for FDA rubber seals in contact with aqueous or fatty foods. The regulation specifies extraction test limits in water and n-hexane.
foodMedical.fdaDescription2: FDA does not approve any products complying with CFR 21.177.2600, only provides regulations for manufacturers and users to follow and choose, with final FDA rubber product manufacturers demonstrating compliance through FDA certificates. It should also be noted that although a component may be made from FDA rubber material suitable for food contact, this does not necessarily mean the component is technically suitable for its intended application.
foodMedical.fdaDescription3: Food and medical grade perfluoroelastomer is widely used in food processing equipment safety due to its excellent chemical and physical properties. We offer FDA-compliant perfluoroelastomer, all materials available in both finished and semi-finished products.
foodMedical.medicalDescription1: Medical grade perfluoroelastomer (Medical grade FFKM) must comply with United States Pharmacopeia Class VI (USP Class VI) regulations. Fluorez® FFKM UFT753, UFT750 have passed two years of material testing by third-party laboratories, complying with USP Chapter 87 (or ISO 10993-5) and Chapter 88 (or ISO 10993-6, -10, -11) requirements, and meeting USP Class VI new compound testing requirements.
foodMedical.medicalDescription2: Fluorez Technology's medical grade perfluoroelastomer also meets food grade requirements, and due to its excellent chemical and physical properties, is widely used in medical devices, pharmaceuticals, and biocompatibility-related fields. All materials are available as finished products.

products.item1: • Standard O-rings (JIS B2401, JIS P, JIS V, JIS G, JIS S and international metric)

ffkm.contact: For other special finished items, please contact us

fkm.title: FKM Fluoroelastomer
fkm.intro1: FKM products generally refer to diamine-crosslinked fluoroelastomers with 66% fluorine content in the raw rubber material, commonly known as Viton®. In fact, there are also high-fluorine FKM products with fluorine content between 67-70%, which have stronger chemical resistance and physical properties compared to regular FKM, but come at a higher price, used in applications with more demanding environmental requirements. Different brands of fluoroelastomers have their own characteristics. For different requirements such as higher temperature resistance, chemical resistance, and resistance to high-temperature water vapor, fluoroelastomers must be manufactured through compounding plants adjusting the FKM raw rubber material and different additives. Therefore, selecting suitable fluoroelastomer products relies not only on experience but also on testing different compound formulations to meet usage requirements.
fkm.intro2: Fluoroelastomer FKM is polymerized from different monomers including vinylidene fluoride (VDF), hexafluoropropylene (HFP), tetrafluoroethylene (TFE), perfluoromethyl vinyl ether (PMVE), and ethylene. FKM made from different monomer combinations has different fluorine content and application performance. Taking Chemours' FKM product Viton® as an example, selection reference is as follows. Fluorez Technology provides customers with various Viton® products and corresponding specification products. For other special finished items, please contact us.

specFkm.title: Special Fluoroelastomers
specFkm.intro1: Special fluoroelastomers refer to fluoroelastomers other than Viton A: including high-fluorine products with fluorine content between 67-70%, which have stronger chemical resistance and physical properties compared to regular FKM but come at a higher price, low-temperature resistant products, and peroxide-cured products. These are used in applications with more demanding environmental requirements. Different brands of fluoroelastomers have their own characteristics. For different requirements such as higher temperature resistance, chemical resistance, and resistance to high-temperature water vapor, fluoroelastomers must be manufactured through compounding plants adjusting the FKM raw rubber material and different additives. Therefore, selecting suitable fluoroelastomer products relies not only on experience but also on testing different compound formulations to meet usage requirements.
specFkm.intro2: Fluorez Technology has its own rubber compounding plant equipment and focuses on FKM compound research and development, selling various standard and custom FKM finished products. We have complete AS-568A, JISB2401P, V, G, S molds. We also accept customer-specified special FKM products, whether in various colors, forms, hardness, or environmental requirements. Metal-bonded fluoroelastomer products are also part of our services, and we can also provide PTFE (Teflon) and PFA-coated seals, FEP (fluoropolymer) spray-coated seals. Additionally, for special environment fluoroelastomer use, we have developed a series of special fluoroelastomer series to handle environments that regular fluoroelastomers cannot handle.
specFkm.conclusion: Similar products in the market are often over-packaged and compared with perfluoroelastomers (FFKM), which is actually meaningless. Because when selecting sealing materials, it's not just about the operating environment - service life is often an important selection point. Regardless of which fluoroelastomer product, each has its own environment where it performs well and corresponding fatigue characteristics. FFKM still has its irreplaceability in terms of cleanliness, service life, and temperature and chemical resistance. For selection, we often recommend customers discuss with manufacturers, as necessary testing is often more efficient than written text. Only by applying suitable materials in suitable application ranges can we achieve balance between economic considerations and expected usage conditions. For other special finished items, please contact us.

pfls.title: PFLs Perfluorinated Liquids
pfls.intro: Perfluorinated liquids are colorless, odorless, non-toxic, and thermally stable perfluorinated fluids that can meet various heat transfer, manufacturing, and testing application needs. Perfluorinated liquids have excellent thermal and chemical stability and are compatible with active materials such as metals, plastics, and elastomers. Perfluorinated liquids with different boiling points are suitable for many single-phase heat transfer applications in semiconductor manufacturing industry and electronic packaging leak testing. With a wide working temperature range, they are suitable for heat transfer applications in equipment such as etchers, ion implanters, and testing equipment.

table2.specificHeat: Specific Heat at Boiling Point J/g

lab.intro: At Fluorez Technology Ltd., we are committed to providing high-quality FKM (Fluoroelastomer) and FFKM (Perfluoroelastomer) products to our customers. Our confidence in product quality stems from our rigorous quality control and comprehensive testing conducted in our advanced internal laboratory.

qualityAssurance.title: Quality Assurance Commitment
qualityAssurance.content: Our comprehensive testing system enables us to closely monitor every step of the production process, from raw materials to final product performance control, ensuring each batch meets strict quality standards. This attention to detail reduces variability and enhances product reliability, providing customers with trustworthy materials.

cleanroom.title: Cleanroom Manufacturing Environment
cleanroom.content: We understand the importance of product purity and contamination control, which is why we have a cleanroom in our factory. This controlled environment minimizes particles and other contaminants in the air, which is particularly important for products used in sensitive applications such as semiconductor manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, and aerospace. The cleanroom ensures our seals and components maintain their integrity and excellent performance even under the most stringent conditions.

customerSupport.title: Customer Support and Technical Expertise
customerSupport.intro: Beyond our production capabilities, we take pride in our extensive knowledge base and rubber technology expertise. Our team is dedicated to providing customers with:
customerSupport.point1: Detailed technical data and guidance to help select materials suitable for specific applications.
customerSupport.point2: Insights into material performance under different operating conditions.
customerSupport.point3: Assistance in problem-solving and optimizing product performance.
customerSupport.conclusion: We believe collaboration and knowledge sharing are key to mutual success. Through working with customers, we strive to develop innovative solutions that meet and exceed industry challenges.

qualityManagement.title: Quality Management System Alignment
qualityManagement.content: Our quality control processes align with international standards such as ISO 9001:2015, ensuring our operations are efficient, consistent, and continuously improving. This alignment demonstrates our commitment to maintaining a quality management system that enhances customer satisfaction and meets regulatory requirements.

lab.conclusion: At Fluorez Technology Ltd., quality is not just a goal—it is a core component of our culture and operations. From our advanced laboratory testing to cleanroom manufacturing and expert customer support, every aspect of our business focuses on delivering excellence. We invite you to experience our commitment to quality firsthand and look forward to the opportunity to meet your needs with our high-performance FKM and FFKM products.

material.ffkmIntro: Chemical Composition: FFKM consists of a fully fluorinated backbone similar to polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE), giving it excellent chemical resistance and high-temperature resistance. Its unique molecular structure includes perfluoroalkyl ether groups, enhancing its flexibility and high-temperature performance. Molecularly, unlike FKM fluoroelastomers, in FFKM perfluoroelastomers, all carbon atoms in the main chain or side chains are bonded to fluorine atoms. This advanced composition ensures FFKM's integrity and performance in extreme environments. In terms of elastomer crosslinking structure, it can be divided into Peroxide-cure and Nitrile-cure. From a basic functional perspective, it can be categorized into chemical resistant, high-temperature resistant, and high purity types. Through compound formulations, products can be further developed to meet different application requirements, such as passing NORSOK M-710/ISO23936-2 certification, or complying with USP Class VI and FDA regulations.
material.ffkmFeature1: Excellent Chemical Resistance: Due to its fully fluorinated structure, FFKM can resist a wide range of chemicals including acids, bases, ketones, esters, phenolic solvents, hydrocarbons, ethers, oils, and steam, making it ideal for chemical processing and industrial applications.
material.ffkmFeature2: High Temperature Tolerance: Able to withstand temperatures up to 330°C (626°F), FFKM maintains its performance at extreme high temperatures, ensuring application stability.
material.ffkmFeature3: Excellent Durability: FFKM provides outstanding mechanical properties and compression set resistance, delivering durable sealing in dynamic applications.
material.ffkmFeature4: Good Gas Tightness: Vacuum resistance can reach 1.33X10-7~1.33X10-8 pa.
material.ffkmFeature5: Diverse Applications: Suitable for various industries including semiconductor manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, oil and gas, and aerospace, FFKM demonstrates excellent performance in the most demanding environments.
material.ffkmConclusion: Our perfluoroelastomer products are designed to meet strict industry standards. Trust Fluorez Technology to provide reliable, high-quality FFKM solutions that meet your specific needs.
material.fkmIntro: Fluoroelastomer FKM has different trade names across different brands. DuPont's™ FKM is known as Viton®, 3M®'s FKM is called Dyneon®; Daikin®'s trade name is DAI-EL®, while fellow Japanese company Asahi Glass® markets theirs as Aflas®. Historically, users often mistakenly thought Viton® was FKM, a misunderstanding caused by long-standing habit. FKM is a fully synthetic high molecular weight elastomer material where carbon atoms in the main chain or side chains are bonded to fluorine atoms. FKM (Fluoroelastomer) characteristics and applications:
material.fkmFeature1_1: FKM typically maintains good elasticity and dimensional stability in temperature ranges from -20°C to 230°C. Higher grades of FKM can even work at higher temperatures up to 250°C, or operate at lower temperatures (-50°C).
material.fkmFeature1_2: This characteristic makes FKM particularly outstanding in high-temperature sealing applications, such as automotive engine cylinder gaskets, valve cover seals, turbocharger O-rings, etc.
material.fkmFeature2_1: FKM has good resistance to various chemicals and solvents, including petroleum products, alkaline solutions, and oxidants. This makes it widely used in sealing and piping systems in petrochemical, chemical processing, and food processing industries.
material.fkmFeature2_2: Particularly in environments with high concentrations of petroleum products and oxidants, FKM can maintain long-term stability and performance.
material.fkmFeature3_1: FKM has excellent oil resistance and can work long-term in petroleum, lubricating oils, and other petrochemical products. This makes it widely used as seals and oil-resistant components in automotive, aviation, and mechanical equipment industries.
material.fkmFeature4_1: FKM has excellent tensile strength, wear resistance, and tear strength, ensuring long-term usability under various mechanical stresses.
material.fkmFeature4_2: Its elastic modulus and hardness can be adjusted according to specific application requirements, adapting to different working environments and operating conditions.
material.fkmApplication1: Automotive Industry: Used in engine seals, air conditioning systems, fuel systems, etc.
material.fkmApplication2: Aerospace: Used in aircraft engine seals, hydraulic systems, fuel systems, etc.
material.fkmApplication3: Petrochemical: Used in pipeline seals, valve seals, chemical transport systems, etc.
material.fkmApplication4: Food Processing: Used in food-grade seals, requiring compliance with FDA or EU food contact certification requirements.
material.fkmApplication5: Pharmaceutical Processing and Medical Devices: Used in medical-grade seals, requiring compliance with USP Class VI requirements.
material.fkmConclusion: In summary, FKM has become an indispensable material in many industrial fields due to its excellent performance characteristics, particularly in applications requiring high temperature, chemical resistance, and oil resistance, where FKM can provide reliable solutions.
material.pflsIntro:
Perfluorinated liquids (PFLs) are colorless, odorless, non-toxic, thermally stable, and chemically inert perfluorinated fluids. Due to their molecular structure where carbon atoms form tight bonds with fluorine atoms, fluorinated liquids have excellent stability, do not react with active materials such as metals, plastics, and elastomers, and are extremely stable. They also have excellent non-conductive and insulating properties at both high and low temperatures. The more well-known perfluorinated liquids in the market are probably Solvay®'s Galden® and 3M®'s Fluorinert®. However, due to their oligopolistic nature, prices are relatively less affordable. Fluorinated liquids are extremely suitable for many single-phase heat transfer applications in semiconductor and electronic component manufacturing industries, replacing traditional conductive refrigerants and water. Fluorinated liquids have a working temperature range of -60°C to 165°C, suitable for equipment such as etchers, ion implanters, gross leaking test equipment's high and low-temperature tanks, and impact testing. PFLs are highly volatile with no residue, and their non-conductive properties also make them suitable for electronic component cleaning. Fluorinated liquids have zero ozone depletion potential. They are not restricted by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), are not subject to volatile organic compound regulations, and do not contribute to surface ozone formation causing environmental damage.

Perfluorinated Liquids (PFLs) Features:
material.pflsFeature1: Non-flammable even in environments with high chlorine and strong oxidants
material.pflsFeature2: Does not react with metals, plastics, rubber, or most materials
material.pflsFeature3: Wide working temperature range available from -60°C to 165°C
material.pflsFeature4: Excellent insulating properties at both high and low temperatures
